intro: Doellingeria ledophylla var. ledophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinct serrated margin, while its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively along the forest floor.
